newsitem.title: UK: CRICKET-MARK WAUGH UNABLE TO PLAY BECAUSE OF STOMACH PAINS.
newsitem.headline: CRICKET-MARK WAUGH UNABLE TO PLAY BECAUSE OF STOMACH PAINS.

text.p: Australian batsman Mark Waugh was unable to bat on the third day of the first test against England after being taken to hospital suffering from stomach pains.

A statement from tour manager Alan Crompton said: "The initial diagnosis is that the problem could be either gastro-intestinal or appendicitis. At this stage it is impossible to confirm either. Mark will remain in hospital for observation for a further 24 hours."

The Australians, struggling to avoid defeat in the first test which finishes on Monday, have already sent to Australia for an additional bowler in Paul Reiffel, because of injuries to Jason Gillespie and Andy Bichel.
